intro: Brassica oleracea proles arvensis, commonly known as field mustard, is a species of flowering plant in the mustard family. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm. The plant has alternate, rough, and hairy leaves that are oval to lance-shaped. Its flowers are small, yellow, and arranged in racemes, and it produces spherical, three-lobed pods containing seeds. This plant is native to Europe and is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides.
